Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ocellatin-V3 (XXA; UCLL1c; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: smooth-skinned ditch frog,Leptodactylus validus, South America

Literature Information.Literature: The very low antimicrobial potency (MIC>200 uM) against E. coli and S. aureus associated with the peptides is probably a consequence of their lack of amphipathicity and reduced cationicity compared with active members of the ocellatin family from related species.
Literature Information.Author: King JD, Leprince J, Vaudry H, Coquet L, Jouenne T, Conlon JM2008
Literature Information.Title: Purification and characterization of antimicrobial peptides from the Caribbean frog, Leptodactylus validus (Anura: Leptodactylidae).
